Store
service in module intermesh.data

Description

A store holds multiple records for display in an ng-repeat item for example

Usage

Store(storeRoute, The[, loadParams]);

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
storeRoutestring

The route to the controller. eg. "intermesh/auth/user/store"

TheModel

models this store is for.

loadParams
(optional)
object

Extra GET parameters for the store action

Methods

  • findIndexByAttribute(attributeName, value)

    Finds a record index by attribute name

    Parameters
    ParamTypeDetails
    attributeNamestring

    Name of the attribute

    valuemixed

    Value of the attribute

    Returns
    int

    Index of record

  • findSingleByAttribute(attributeName, value)

    Finds a record by attribute name

    Parameters
    ParamTypeDetails
    attributeNamestring

    Name of the attribute

    valuemixed

    Value of the attribute

    Returns
    Model

    The model found or false on failure

  • load(params)

    Loads new items for the store.

    Parameters
    ParamTypeDetails
    paramsobject

    Key value pair of GET params for the request

    Returns
    HttpPromise

    Returns a HttpPromise. See: https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/service/$http#get

  • loadData()

    Manually add an array of data to the store.

    Example data:

    [{attributeName: value}, {attributeName: value}]

  • nextPage()

    Loads the next page for the store

    Returns
    HttpPromise

    Returns a HttpPromise. See: https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/service/$http#get

  • reload()

    Reload the entire store

    Returns
    HttpPromise

    Returns a HttpPromise. See: https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/service/$http#get

  • remove(index)

    Removes a record

    Parameters
    ParamTypeDetails
    indexint

    Index of record to remove

  • reset()

    Reset the store to an empty state

  • saveSortOrder(route)

    Save the sortOrder of these store items

    $scope.dragControlListeners =  {
	accept: function (sourceItemHandleScope, destSortableScope) {
		//override to determine drag is allowed or not. default is true.
		return true;
	},
	itemMoved: function (event) {
		console.log(event);
	},
	orderChanged: function(event) {
		$scope.store.saveSortOrder('IPE/KeepNotes/Note/saveSort');
	}
	//containment: '#board'//optional param.
};
    Parameters
    ParamTypeDetails
    routestring

    The route to the php controller action

    Returns
    HttpPromise

    Returns a HttpPromise. See: https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/service/$http#post

  • search()

    Loads the store but passes this.searchQuery

    Returns
    HttpPromise

    Returns a HttpPromise. See: https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/service/$http#get

  • shouldLoad()

    Reset the store to an empty state

    Returns
    boolean

    Returns false if the store should not be loaded. eg. when it's busy or loaded completely.
